results.title: Worsening Hypothyroidism in the Setting of New-Onset Nephrotic Syndrome
results.text_hl: Her symptoms gradually improved after receiving a higher dose of @CHEMICAL_Thyroxine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013974 @@@levothyroxine@@@, along with diuretics and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ initiation.

citations.NLM: Wang Q, Ravi D, Tang Z, Nand N, Dahhan A. Worsening Hypothyroidism in the Setting of New-Onset Nephrotic Syndrome Cureus. 2023 Aug;15(8):e43345. PMID: 37701005

results.title: Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis
results.text_hl: @GENE_BMP1 @GENE_649 @@@BMP@@@ was unremarkable a month ago when started on @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Sendil S, Yarlagadda K, Lawal H, Nookala V, Shingala H. Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis Cureus. 2020 Jul 10;12(7):e9119. PMID: 32699722
citations.BibTeX: @article{32699722, title={Metformin Associated Lactic Acidosis in the Intensive Care Unit: A Rare Condition Mimicking Sepsis}, author={Sendil S and Yarlagadda K and Lawal H and Nookala V and Shingala H}, journal={Cureus}, volume={12}, number={7}, pages={e9119}}

results.title: Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent adverse events reported were @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, although not all of these events were thought to be related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; 6.1% discontinued @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ due to adverse clinical events, most commonly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ and @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron HA, Higgins TJ. Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():177-86. PMID: 2550641
citations.BibTeX: @article{2550641, title={Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.}, author={Cameron HA and Higgins TJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={3 Suppl 1}, pages={177-86}}

results.title: Lisinopril versus placebo in the treatment of heart failure: the Lisinopril Heart Failure Study Group.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, the increase in exercise duration was accompanied by an improvement in quality of life as measured by the Yale Scale @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@Dyspnea@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@Fatigue@@@ Index and in signs and symptoms of @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Beller B, Bulle T, Bourge RC, Colfer H, Fowles RE, Giles TD, Grover J, Whipple JP, Fisher MB, Jessup M. Lisinopril versus placebo in the treatment of heart failure: the Lisinopril Heart Failure Study Group. J Clin Pharmacol. 1995 Jul;35(7):673-80. PMID: 7560247
citations.BibTeX: @article{7560247, title={Lisinopril versus placebo in the treatment of heart failure: the Lisinopril Heart Failure Study Group.}, author={Beller B and Bulle T and Bourge RC and Colfer H and Fowles RE and Giles TD and Grover J and Whipple JP and Fisher MB and Jessup M}, journal={J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={35}, number={7}, pages={673-80}}

results.title: Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.
results.text_hl: In clinical trials, adverse experiences in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with a @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ combination were @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (7.5%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (5.2%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (3.9%), @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (3.7%), @DISEASE_Headache @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@ (3.2%), @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (2.5%), @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (2.2%) and @DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper respiratory tract infection@@@ (2.2%).

citations.NLM: Murray NH. Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment. J Hum Hypertens. 1991 Dec;5 Suppl 2():63-7; discussion 68. PMID: 1665180
citations.BibTeX: @article{1665180, title={Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.}, author={Murray NH}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={5 Suppl 2}, pages={63-7; discussion 68}}

results.title: Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@Cough@@@, malaise and @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@ were more frequent causes of withdrawal from @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ than @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Fallowfield JM, Blenkinsopp J, Raza A, Fowkes AG, Higgins TJ, Bridgman KM. Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK. Br J Clin Pract. 1993 Nov-Dec;47(6):296-304. PMID: 8117550
citations.BibTeX: @article{8117550, title={Post-marketing surveillance of lisinopril in general practice in the UK.}, author={Fallowfield JM and Blenkinsopp J and Raza A and Fowkes AG and Higgins TJ and Bridgman KM}, journal={Br J Clin Pract}, volume={47}, number={6}, pages={296-304}}

results.title: Short- and long-acting angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors: a randomized trial of lisinopril versus captopril in the treatment of congestive heart failure. The Multicenter Lisinopril-Captopril Congestive Heart Failure Study Group.
results.text_hl: Improvement in functional capacity and quality of life, as assessed by the Yale Scale @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ index, was significantly greater for the @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Giles TD, Katz R, Sullivan JM, Wolfson P, Haugland M, Kirlin P, Powers E, Rich S, Hackshaw B, Chiaramida A. Short- and long-acting angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors: a randomized trial of lisinopril versus captopril in the treatment of congestive heart failure. The Multicenter Lisinopril-Captopril Congestive Heart Failure Study Group. J Am Coll Cardiol. 1989 May;13(6):1240-7. PMID: 2539403

results.title: Changes in dyspnea-fatigue ratings as indicators of quality of life in the treatment of congestive heart failure.
results.text_hl: Changes in @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@dyspnea@@@-@<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ ratings as indicators of quality of life in the treatment of @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@congestive heart failure@@@.

citations.NLM: Feinstein AR, Fisher MB, Pigeon JG. Changes in dyspnea-fatigue ratings as indicators of quality of life in the treatment of congestive heart failure. Am J Cardiol. 1989 Jul 1;64(1):50-5. PMID: 2545092

results.title: Quality of life with ACE inhibitors in chronic heart failure.
results.text_hl: The Minnesota Living with @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@Heart Failure@@@ Questionnaire has demonstrated the benefits of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ in some but not all circumstances and the Yale @DISEASE_Dyspnea @DISEASE_MESH:D004417 @@@Dyspnea@@@-@<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@Fatigue@@@ Index improves with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Bulpitt CJ. Quality of life with ACE inhibitors in chronic heart failure. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1996;27 Suppl 2():S31-5. PMID: 8723397
